  • java.lang.Object

extends java.lang.Object
    The internal API for the file database

      • listUserFiles

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Long> listUserFiles(java.lang.String executingUser,
                                                         java.lang.String targetUser)
                                                  throws HttpException
        Returns all files the user has access to.
        Parameters:
        executingUser - The ID of the executing user.
        targetUser - The ID of the user to get the files from.
        Returns:
        A list of all file IDs the user has access to.
        Throws:
        HttpException - See UserDB.checkAPIPermission(String, String).
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getFile

        public org.json.JSONObject getFile(java.lang.String user,
                                   long id,
                                   boolean metadataOnly)
                            throws HttpException
        Returns either the metadata or the content of the file.
        Parameters:
        user - The owner of the file.
        id - The id of the file.
        metadataOnly - Request metadata only when true.
        Returns:
        The metadata or the content of the file.
        Throws:
        HttpException - When the server is in an illegal IO state (i.e. FileUtils.readUntil(File, char), FileUtils.readFrom(File, char) throws an exception).
        Since:
        1.0.0

        Parameters:
        user - The owner of the file.
        id - The id of the file.
        content - The new content.
        Throws:
        HttpException - See FileUtils.write(File, String).
        Since:

      • deleteFile

        public void deleteFile(java.lang.String user,
                       long id)
                throws HttpException
        Deletes a file.
        Parameters:
        user - The owner of the file.
        id - The id of the file.
        Throws:
        HttpException - When the user has no access to the file.
        Since:
        1.0.0
